data.author: Bill Goldberg

data.quote: I have been very happy, very rich, very beautiful, much adulated, very famous and very unhappy.
data.author: Brigitte Bardot

data.quote: Famous is celebrityism, and I don't want that... I know that I'm not that. Everybody knows who you are. I can't imagine living that life, but I don't think I consider myself famous.
data.author: Robin Wright

data.quote: Because you know when you first become famous, you start walking a little different because people are staring at you.
data.author: Bono

data.quote: I admire sensible, kind people. They're not often famous.
data.author: John Malkovich

data.quote: It isn't necessary to be rich and famous to be happy. It's only necessary to be rich.
data.author: Alan Alda

data.quote: What I can't completely understand is most other people's fascination with what the famous among us do with their lips and the rest of their bodies. Why do ordinary people become the target of this curiosity simply by virtue of the fact that other people recognise their names and faces but know almost nothing else about them?
data.author: Alan Alda

data.quote: I had never really wanted to be famous. Everyone is supposed to want to be rich and famous, but as a boy I never knew what rich was, and the first view I had of famous made me leery.
data.author: Alan Alda

data.quote: I can't relate to people who treat me as a 'famous person.' I only like to hang around with people who treat me as a regular person because that's what I am. All people are really just regular.
data.author: Judy Blume

data.quote: My hair was famous before I was.
data.author: Christopher Walken

data.quote: Celebrity was a long time in coming it will go away. Everything goes away.
data.author: Carol Burnett

data.quote: But I didn't ask to have somebody nose around in my private life. I didn't even ask to be famous. All I asked was to be able to earn a living making people laugh.
data.author: Carol Burnett

data.quote: You can get rich or famous by doing the same thing.
data.author: Ang Lee

data.quote: I'm doing a new musical on Broadway, which opens in October called 'The Boy from Oz,' where I play Peter Allen. For those of you who don't know, he became first famous in America for marrying Liza Minelli.
data.author: Hugh Jackman

data.quote: The problem is, the more famous you get, the more people see you who didn't choose to.
data.author: Louis C. K.

data.quote: Show me an actor who doesn't want to be famous, and I'll show you a liar. Later, you realise that there's more to it than just the acquisition of fame, and money and girls. But that is what drives them and was what drove me, initially.
data.author: Kevin Bacon

data.quote: Any idiot can get laid when they're famous. That's easy. It's getting laid when you're not famous that takes some talent.
data.author: Kevin Bacon

data.quote: My dad was an architect, and he wasn't a rich guy, but in our little world in Philadelphia, he was famous. He loved to see his picture in the paper. I wanted to be more famous than him.
data.author: Kevin Bacon

data.quote: There are two types of actors: those who say they don't want to be famous, and those who are liars.
data.author: Kevin Bacon

data.quote: One of the top comments I get from people is, 'Oh my God, you're like a regular person!' That's kind of a bizarre thing to live with. I know a lot of famous people, and their lives may not be regular, but they are regular people.
data.author: Kevin Bacon

data.quote: I wasn't going off to New York to be more famous than my father, but in retrospect, that certainly was driving me. He was famous in Philadelphia, but it was also really important to him to be famous. And to a certain extent, I got some of that, even though there were parts of it that horrified me.
data.author: Kevin Bacon

data.quote: I turned down many chances to be on TV before 'Pop Idol' because I really wasn't interested in being famous. I didn't need it and didn't want it.
data.author: Simon Cowell

data.quote: I've interviewed presidents and royalty, rock stars and movie stars, famous generals and captains of industry; I've had front row seats at Super Bowls, World Series, and Olympic Games; my books have been on best-seller lists, and my marriage is a long-running success.
data.author: Tom Brokaw

data.quote: I'm always so amazed by which performances work really, really well and which ones don't. But I think it's just mostly, 'She's Out Of My League,' so many people saw that movie on DVD and on the plane. Just millions of people saw that movie. That's the reason I'm somewhat famous.
data.author: T. J. Miller

data.quote: Sometimes you forget you're famous. You wonder, 'Why is that person staring at me?'
data.author: Bob Newhart

data.quote: Frost was no match for Nixon - far from being an intrepid and challenging interviewer, he was a pushover for the great and the famous, always deeply impressed with the fact that here he was, David Frost, putting questions to - Richard Nixon!
data.author: Michael Korda

data.quote: The rich and famous expect to get a lot for their story, whether they are writing it themselves or not. It's not that they need the money, of course; it's a question of ego, like catching the biggest fish.
data.author: Michael Korda

data.quote: Of course the rich and famous tend to have more going on in their lives than ordinary people, but they aren't always willing to tell the interesting bits.
data.author: Michael Korda

data.quote: Peter Fleming was a famous English traveler, explorer and adventurer, whose non-fiction books were hugely successful. My father owned signed copies of all of them - he and Peter Fleming had become acquainted over some detail of set design at the Korda film studio in Shepperton - and I had read each of them with breathless adolescent excitement.
data.author: Michael Korda

data.quote: See, 'A Time to Kill' was the one I got famous off of. Big ka-boom, over one weekend. After that, I did films that I really wanted to do.
data.author: Matthew McConaughey

data.quote: What I do is what I like; if I'm not as famous as I'd like to be, I've done it to myself.
data.author: Blake Shelton

data.quote: The fire in the belly is essential, otherwise you become Michael Buble - famous and meaningless.
data.author: Morrissey

data.quote: I became famous, I think, really because of the interpretation of other people's songs, way back when, and that's what I enjoy the most. And I'm a lazy bugger.
data.author: Rod Stewart

data.quote: There is this power that comes with being famous.
data.author: Rod Stewart

data.quote: I have some idea of the pressure of finding your own identity with a famous father.
data.author: Michael Douglas

data.quote: I don't want to be famous as a movie star and have the whole world love me, I want to be a creative actress.
data.author: Juliette Lewis

data.quote: When you become famous at 19, it does a number in your head, so you find romance in the mundane - isn't it so great that a guy would pick me up at my house and take me to a restaurant?
data.author: Juliette Lewis

data.quote: I've never really cared if I was famous for my music. It was just something I had to do.
data.author: Juliette Lewis

data.quote: I'd rather be the protector than the protected. I'm naturally the protector - being a mother and having a famous family. You have to navigate when it's right to protect.
data.author: Solange Knowles

data.quote: In journalism, we recognize a kind of hierarchy of fame among the famous. We measure it in two ways: by the length of an obituary and by how far in advance it is prepared. Presidents, former presidents, and certain heads of state are at the top of the chain.
data.author: Walter Cronkite

data.quote: Sometimes a famous subject may even outlive his own obituary writer.
data.author: Walter Cronkite

data.quote: Being famous has changed a lot, because now there's so many outlets, between magazines, TV shows, and the Internet, for people to stalk and follow you. We created the monster.
data.author: Madonna Ciccone

data.quote: Did you ever stop to think why cops are always famous for being dumb? Simple. Because they don't have to be anything else.
data.author: Orson Welles
